overview.title: PR Metrics Overview
overview.subtitle: Automated analysis of pull request metrics

draftPr.title: Draft PR Skipped
draftPr.message: Analysis skipped as this PR is in draft status.

violations.title: Violations
violations.allWithinLimits: All files are within size limits

complexity.title: Code Complexity Analysis
complexity.allBelowThreshold: All files are below complexity threshold (medium threshold: {{threshold}})
complexity.moreFiles: +{{count}} more files exceed complexity threshold (not shown)

skippedFiles.title: Skipped Files
skippedFiles.reason: The following files were excluded from complexity analysis (not counted in metrics):
skippedFiles.syntaxErrorNote: Note: Syntax errors should be fixed by developers and are included in PR quality assessment.

syntaxErrorFiles.title: Syntax Error Files
syntaxErrorFiles.reason: The following files have syntax errors and are **counted with complexity 0 in the metrics**:
syntaxErrorFiles.note: Note: Syntax errors should be fixed by developers and are included in PR quality assessment.

prFilesLimit.title: PR File Count Limitation
prFilesLimit.reason: Some files in this PR were excluded from analysis due to GitHub API limitations.
prFilesLimit.note: Note: Large PRs may not be fully analyzed due to GitHub API's 3000 file limit.

tsconfigNotFound.title: tsconfig.json Not Found
tsconfigNotFound.reason: tsconfig.json was not found, using default settings (ecmaVersion: 'latest', sourceType: 'module').
tsconfigNotFound.note: Note: For TypeScript projects, having a tsconfig.json enables more accurate analysis.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.splitPr: Consider splitting this PR into smaller changes
recommendations.reviewCarefully: Review carefully due to high complexity
recommendations.goodSize: PR size is appropriate for review

improvementActions.title: Improvement Actions
improvementActions.intro: Here are some ways to reduce your PR size:

splitting.title: PR Splitting Strategies
splitting.byFeature: Split by feature: Create separate PRs for independent features
splitting.byFileGroups: Split by file groups: Group related files and merge incrementally
splitting.separateRefactoring: Separate refactoring and new features: Keep code improvements and new functionality in different PRs

refactoring.title: Large File Refactoring
refactoring.splitFunctions: Split functions or classes into multiple files
refactoring.extractCommon: Extract common logic into separate modules
refactoring.organizeByLayer: Organize files by layer (utils, services, components)

generated.title: Handling Generated/Lock Files
generated.separateGenerated: Consider updating auto-generated code in separate PRs

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.splitLogical: Split large changes into logical commits
bestPractices.documentChanges: Document significant changes in commit messages
bestPractices.reviewBefore: Review your own code before requesting review

fileSize.title: File Size Guidelines
fileSize.under500: Aim for under 500 lines per file
fileSize.under300: For complex files, under 300 lines is ideal

reviewTips.title: Review Efficiency Tips
reviewTips.smallerFaster: Smaller PRs merge faster and reduce CI/CD load
reviewTips.largeMultiple: Large PRs tend to require multiple review rounds
reviewTips.groupRelated: Group related changes together to minimize context switching
